conclusion: Apply principles of magnetic force and right-angle wire configuration.
Formula for force on a current-carrying wire: F = IB × L.
Given values: Length of wire L = 3L, Magnetic induction intensity B, Current I.
Calculate total length of wire: Total length = L + 2L = 3L.
Apply formula for magnetic force: F = IB × 3L.
Substitute given values into formula: F = I × 3L.
Assume I = 1 for simplicity, force F becomes: F = 3 × 1 × 3L = 9L.
Since L = 3L, force F becomes: F = 9 × 3L = 27L.
